OK here's my first attempt at a NWN build in 10 years, so there will be mistakes.

I went back to the very first build in this section to find a build with the same three classes, but this is different in several ways - it focuses more on casting and less on being an Assassin and it tries to probably cover too much ground by leveraging in ESF Necro and Automatic Quicken and also getting sneak to a reasonable level, so I'm hoping for some constructive feedback. TBH I can't recall what works and what doesn't very well. I probably don't need ITWF for example, but unsure of what might be better and I could do with some help on skills - I put in what I thought was necessary and left the balance, but maybe I don't need so many points and I'm unsure about the order and whether I should push for BAB21 at the cost of Wizard levels (I think not, but could be wrong).

EDIT: The idea is a full strength caster with HiPS (arguably the best Feat in the game) and the cheesy ability to land Death Attacks. He has two weapons against other casters - Autoquicken and HiPS - that should give him an edge in Mage vs Mage battles. As he goes Wizard to level 7 spells and then gets HiPS shortly afterwards he's as playable 1-40 as any Wizard.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Thorsson wrote: OK here's my first attempt at a NWN build in 10 years, so there will be mistakes.

I went back to the very first build in this section to find a build with the same three classes, but this is different in several ways - it focuses more on casting and less on being an Assassin and it tries to probably cover too much ground by leveraging in ESF Necro and Automatic Quicken and also getting sneak to a reasonable level, so I'm hoping for some constructive feedback. TBH I can't recall what works and what doesn't very well. I probably don't need ITWF for example, but unsure of what might be better and I could do with some help on skills - I put in what I thought was necessary and left the balance, but maybe I don't need so many points and I'm unsure about the order and whether I should push for BAB21 at the cost of Wizard levels (I think not, but could be wrong).

EDIT: The idea is a full strength caster with HiPS (arguably the best Feat in the game) and the cheesy ability to land Death Attacks. He has two weapons against other casters - Autoquicken and HiPS - that should give him an edge in Mage vs Mage battles. As he goes Wizard to level 7 spells and then gets HiPS shortly afterwards he's as playable 1-40 as any Wizard.
A HIPSing wizard is a good concept. HIPS gives good crowd control.
The stealth skills are very good with the skill boosting feats.
The spell DC is good, and Necro is an excellent choice to focus in.
35 levels of wizard gives adequate spell penetration.

The build is indeed open to any race, but half-orc is of course at a disadvantage with its intelligence penalty. Both elf and halfling have the dexterity bonus. And both races will also work well with rogue instead of assassin without suffering an xp penalty. Halfling will have better AB, AC and stealth.
The DC for Death attack paralysis is only 23. I would have taken rogue instead of assassin. Rogue will also bring more skill points to the table.

AB will almost always be low with such a wizard intense build. I don't understand why you have taken the TWF related feats. This is not a build with focus on physical combat. You have not taken one AB enhancing feat (WF, EWF, Epic prowess).

A general rule is not to take pre epic feats in epic feat slots. There are exceptions. But you don't have to do it here.
Auto quicken offers little. You achieve the same with haste. Use a perma-haste item, or buff with extended haste before battle instead.

You have not given us the starting and ending abilities of your build except for intelligence that starts at 17 and ends at 30. I can Guess from the skill listing that Dexterity is 18. But that's it.
Have a look at the Character builds Posting Rules for Reference.

Bottom line: This wizard will do what you set out to do. But there is room for improvement. You should be able to add a coupe of epic spells and still have room for some more great intelligence feats.
